title.narrative: Hydropower Development on the Sanaga River Technical Assistance Project

description.narrative: The Project development objective is to improve the Recipient's institutional capacity for a sustainable development of hydroelectric resources on the Sanaga River Basin.

condition.narrative: In order to ensure the timely carrying out of the audits referred to in Section II. B.3, the Recipient shall recruit, in accordancewith the provisions of Section III of this Schedule 2, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, an external auditorwith qualifications, experience and term of reference acceptable to the Association. (Schedule 2, Section II.B.4 of the FinancingAgreement)

No later than twenty-four (24) months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall establish and thereafter maintain at all timesuntil the completion of the Project, a special river basin commission for the management of the optimization of hydroelectricity onthe Sanaga River Basin with a composition, mandate and resources satisfactory to the Association. (Schedule 2, Section V.B. of theFinancing Agreement)

The Recipient shall afford the Association a reasonable opportunity to review the SESA and said action plan; thereafter, but notlater than three (3) months after the completion of the SESA, disclose in an accessible public manner and adopt such action planas shall have been agreed with the Association. (Schedule 2, Section I.F.1a of the Financing Agreement)

The Recipient shall maintain at all times until the completion of the Project, a Project steering committee with composition,mandate and resources satisfactory to the Association. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.1.a. of the Financing Agreement)

Without limitations upon the provisions of Section I.F of this Schedule 2, in the event of the development of hydropower projectson the Sanaga River Basin in a manner which materially differs from the results of the optimization study and recommendations ofthe SESA referred to in Part A.1 of the Project, the Association reserves the right to cancel the allocated Financing for PartsA.2, A.3 and A.4 of the Project. (Schedule 2, Section V.C. of the Financing Agreement)

title.narrative: Generation capacity (MW) benefiting from the sustainaibility mechanisms developed under the project (i.e. Hydrology risk mitigationmechanisms and Dam safety framework adopted
of which those completed by women
Number of internships completed under the Project
Project-related grievances registered under the project grievance redress mechanism and addressed
Climate change study and impact on hydrology on the Sanaga River prepared
Bankable feasibility study (including engineering and safeguards studies) completed
Bidding documents for the selection of a private concessionnaire available
All publicly funded Hydroelectric Assets are under an O&M contract
An operational model for managing reservoirs according to the forecasted and real time energy needs has been developed
Assistant Project Manager to EDC for the operationalization of the Permanent Technical Secretariat of the Sanaga Basin Commission is recruited
Bidding documents for the selection of a developer for the selected hydropower project prepared
Capacity needs assessment completed to identify future skills needs for Cameroon when developing the hydroelectricity value chain over the next 20 years
Dam safety assessment of Mapé, Bamendjin and Mbakaou completed
Feasibility study for the selected hydropower project completed and ESIA published
Hydrology and Climate Change Study on the Sanaga River completed and approved by the Steering Committee
Hydrology risk mitigation mechanisms identified and implementation roadmap prepared
Methodology developed to evaluate the specific capacity enhancement of the Recipients’ human resources achieved by implementing theproject
Priority Hydroelectric site on the Sanaga River identified and awarded to a private concessionaire on a competitive basis for its development
Sanaga River Basin Hydropower Potential Optimization Study available and approved by the Steering Committee
Panel of Experts, including dam safety and environmental and social expertise, recruited
Qualified technical assistance for oversight of Nachtigal Hydropower Project’s construction recruited before the works start
Dam safety framework adopted by MINEE and ready for implementation
